publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-ÖyRothkuppelraumduring T III MQR 31 (on the frame)/ T III MQ 79 (on the frame)

seg.seg: Glück mit Leid [ist] miteinander nicht nach Wunsch erlangbar.
Bliss with suffering [is] not obtainable together as per wish.
Einer, der wie du [wtl. zusammen mit dir] in Liebe [Glück und Leid] fernhält, wird nicht gefunden [d.h. einen, der ... fernhält, gibt es nicht].
[Some]one who like you [lit. together with you] in love keeps [bliss and suffering] away is not found [i.e. one, who ... keeps away does not exist].
Even when those who love have come to one another, if the mind hurts ... (love?)

Even when those who love have come to one another, if the mind hurts … (love?) turns (away?) … You are fit to protect the mind of the whole world. … (mind) … and you love [beyond] the love there is to you. (cf 739)
turns (away?) ... You are fit to protect the mind of the whole world. ... (mind) ...
and you love [beyond] the love there is to you. Only then have the people of this time love,
Nur dann (haben) die Menschen dieser Zeit Liebe, nur um Dinge zu (erlangen), lieben sie. Hört [aber] das Ding auf, [so] (wendet sich) auch die Liebe ab.
Only then (do) the people of this time (have) love, only to (obtain) things do they love. If [however] the thing ceases, love (turns away) also.
Only then have the people of this time love, if they love to obtain things. If the thing ceases [to exist], [their] love turns away too. Your love to all is enduring without a thing.
if they love to obtain things. If the thing ceases [to exist], [their] love turns away too.
Your love to all is enduring without a thing.

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a5-b2 Even when those who love have come to one another, if the mind hurts … (love?) turns (away?) … You are fit to protect the mind of the whole world. … (mind) … and you love [beyond] the love there is to you. (cf [[Thomas 1954]]: 739) 679
b2-4 Only then have the people of this time love, if they love to obtain things. If the thing ceases [to exist], [their] love turns away too. Your love to all is enduring without a thing. 679

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1-2 Glück mit Leid [ist] miteinander nicht nach Wunsch erlangbar. 216, fn. 1
a2 Einer, der wie du [wtl. zusammen mit dir] in Liebe [Glück und Leid] fernhält, wird nicht gefunden [d.h. einen, der ... fernhält, gibt es nicht]. 216
b2-3 Nur dann (haben) die Menschen dieser Zeit Liebe, nur um Dinge zu (erlangen), lieben sie. Hört [aber] das Ding auf, [so] (wendet sich) auch die Liebe ab. 143


additional classification A1

a5 Even when those who love have come to one another, if the mind hurts ... (love?) b1 turns (away?) ... You are fit to protect the mind of the whole world. ... (mind) ... b2 and you love [beyond] the love there is to you. Only then have the people of this time love, b3 if they love to obtain things. If the thing ceases [to exist], [their] love turns away too. b4 Your love to all is enduring without a thing.
